Sentence.sentence: While these numbers are still being validated by the state, we feel any adjustments they might suggest will be immaterial, Morgan wrote to the presidents.

Sentence.sentence: While alternative estimates of the damage from carbon emissions differ, and it's especially hard to reckon the likely costs of possible catastrophic climate events, most estimates suggest substantial negative effects.

Sentence.sentence: On the contrary, all the facts suggest that high unemployment in America is the result of inadequate demand.

Sentence.sentence: Stress is also starting earlier  in life, with some data suggesting that today's teens are even more stressed than adults.

Sentence.sentence: Some research does suggest that these programs hold promise.

Sentence.sentence: One analyst suggests it is necessary to accept both the positive and negative aspects of innovative products.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Evidence from Australia suggests plain packaging pushes society further along that road.

Sentence.sentence: But more recently, companies have begun to plan more affordable After being dogged by technical delays for years, Sir Richard Branson, Virgin Galactic's founder, had recently suggested that a SpaceShipTwo craft would carry its first paying customers as soon as February 2015.

Sentence.sentence: For this to happen, he suggests the multi-cultural managers exhibit understanding of their own and others’cultural influences and limitations.

Sentence.sentence: Casey, an expert in this field, suggests that the cooperation process within teams mustbe organized, promoted and managed.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Ask your pharmacist whether he can suggest a drug that will relieve the symptoms but that will not cause the adverse reaction.

Sentence.sentence: Based on the finding, the researchers suggest that the key to boosting your willpower is to believe that you have an abundant supply of it.

Sentence.sentence: Conventional wisdom would seem to suggest that companies have no incentive to lengthen the life cycle of their products and reduce the revenue they would get from selling new goods.

Sentence.sentence: CubeSat researchers suggest that now's the time to ponder unexpected and unintended possible consequences of more people than ever having access to their own small slice of space.

Sentence.sentence: Hall's findings suggest there's an argument to be made for electing to use "African American", though one can't help but get the sense that it's a decision that papers over the urgency of continued progress.

Sentence.sentence: I suggest you go to the library and get a copy of his biography.

Sentence.sentence: In fact, when Twenge previously used this data to suggest a screen time effect, some commentators were quick to raise this problem.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Of course, the closed stores, depressed executives, and sinking stocks suggest otherwise.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Our findings suggest that even more modest attention difficulties can increase the risk of negative academic outcomes.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: So, despite all the talk about drone deliveries to your doorstep, all the retail executives expressing anxiety over consumers going online, and even a Presidential candidate exclaiming that Amazon has a " huge antitrust problem, " the Census data suggest

Sentence.sentence: Such findings, he says, suggest that "this network can be called on to process and store the kind of information taught in school—potentially giving students access to a range of untapped mental powers".

Sentence.sentence: They are not very special and I would not suggest them as a gift.

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"暗示"之意。
means: hint ： 指通过时间接而有提示性的话语或表情来暗示某事。
imply ： 侧重指话语、行为或情景中的一种暗示，听者或读者必须加以逻辑推断才能领会。
suggest ： 指有意或无意的，直接或间接暗示，强调事物的表征等使人引起联想。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"表示……的意思"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: mean, imply, indicate, represent, denote, signify, suggest
means: mean ： 最普通用词。指文字或符号等所表示的各种明确的或含蓄的意义。
imply ： 侧重用文字或符号表示的联想，暗示。
denote ： 指某一词字面或狭义的意思，或指某些符号或迹象的特指含义。
signify ： 指用文字、说话或表情等表示单纯的意思。
suggest ： 通常指暗含地、隐晦地表达意思。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"劝告，主张，建议"之意。
means: recommend ： 指向对方提出公开的建议或规劝。
advocate ： 指公开表明对某事或某行为的完全赞同，语气强于recommend。
propose ： 多指较正式地提出建议。
suggest ： 语气较委婉，指提出不成熟的建议或参考意见。
prescribe ： 多指医生对病人在用药或饮食等方面的建议。

sentences.en: They accepted the paper and suggested only one change.
sentences.cn: 他们接受了这篇论文, 只提出改动一个地方。

sentences.en: What I suggest to do in this matter is this.
sentences.cn: 在这个问题上, 我建议这样做。

sentences.en: I suggested waiting.
sentences.cn: 我建议等候。

sentences.en: May I suggest you closing the door?
sentences.cn: 我要求你把门关起来好吗?

sentences.en: We suggested Eby's doing it in a different way.
sentences.cn: 我们建议伊比换一种方式做。

sentences.en: They suggested we should visit a class right away.
sentences.cn: 他们建议我们马上去听课。

sentences.en: Her smile suggests her consent.
sentences.cn: 她的微笑意味着同意。

sentences.en: His attitude suggests that he isn't really interested.
sentences.cn: 他的态度表明他并不真的感兴趣。

sentences.en: The sight of birds suggested a new idea for flying machines.
sentences.cn: 鸟的形象使人产生一个制造航空机的新主意。

sentences.en: It was suggested that he be the chairman of the meeting.
sentences.cn: 他被举荐为大会主席。

sentences.en: The ring suggests that he was on the scene of the crime.
sentences.cn: 这只戒指表明他在作案现场。

means.word_mean: 启示，启发；促使做(或思考)

sentences.en: Having been suggested by a bat, people invented sonar.
sentences.cn: 受到蝙蝠的启发，人们发明了声呐。 </seg>

sentence.cn: 吉姆为什么建议玛丽买这本书？
sentence.en: Why does jim suggest mary buy the book?
sentence.from: 2017年高考英语全国卷2 听力 题设

entry.def: If you suggest something, you put forward a plan or idea for someone to think about.

example.ex: He suggested a link between class size and test results of seven-year-olds...
example.tran: 他认为 7 岁大的学生的测试分数和班级的规模有关系。

example.ex: I suggest you ask him some specific questions about his past...
example.tran: 我建议你问他一些有关他的过去的具体问题。

entry.def: If you suggest the name of a person or place, you recommend them to someone.

example.ex: Could you suggest someone to advise me how to do this?...
example.tran: 这该怎么办？你能不能推荐一个人帮我出个主意？

example.ex: They can suggest where to buy one.
example.tran: 他们可以推荐去哪里购买。

entry.def: If you suggest that something is the case, you say something which you believe is the case.

example.ex: I'm not suggesting that is what is happening...
It is wrong to suggest that there are easy alternatives...
example.tran: 如果认为有更容易的选择，那就错了。

entry.def: If one thing suggests another, it implies it or makes you think that it might be the case.

example.ex: Earlier reports suggested that a meeting would take place on Sunday...
example.tran: 早先的报道暗示周日可能会召开会议。

example.ex: Its hairy body suggests a mammal.
example.tran: 它毛茸茸的身体表明它是哺乳动物。

entry.def: If one thing suggests another, it brings it to your mind through an association of ideas.

example.ex: This onomatopoeic word suggests to me the sound a mousetrap makes when it snaps shut.
example.tran: 这个拟声词让我想起捕鼠夹子突然合上时的声音。

means.word_mean: 1. make a proposal, declare a plan for something

sentences.sentence: "The evidence suggests a need for more clarification"

means.word_mean: 3. drop a hint; intimate by a hint
4. suggest the necessity of an intervention; in medicine;

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent.: from Latin suggest- 'suggested, prompted', from the verb suggerere, from sub- 'from below' + gerere 'bring'

sentences.cn: 先生，吃这道菜，我给您推荐一种白葡萄酒，好吗？
sentences.en: May I suggest a white wine with this dish, Sir?

sentences.cn: 我马上想到了一个解决办法。
sentences.en: A solution immediately suggested itself to me (= I immediately thought of a solution) .

sentences.cn: 我提议我们出去吃吧。
sentences.en: I suggest (that) we go out to eat.

sentences.cn: 我提议坐我的车去。
sentences.en: I suggested going in my car.

sentences.cn: 有人提议天资好的孩子提前考试。
sentences.en: It has been suggested that bright children take their exams early.

sentences.cn: 有人提议天资好的孩子提前考试。
sentences.en: (British English also)It has been suggested that bright children should take their exams early.

sentences.cn: 要你说，谁适合做这个工作？
sentences.en: Who would you suggest for the job?

sentences.cn: 她推荐说，巴黎是举行这次会议的理想地点。
sentences.en: She suggested Paris as a good place for the conference.

sentences.cn: 你能推荐一本好词典吗？
sentences.en: Can you suggest a good dictionary?

sentences.cn: 我怎么才能联系上他，你能出个主意吗？
sentences.en: Can you suggest how I might contact him?

sentences.cn: 所有证据都表明是他偷了钱。
sentences.en: All the evidence suggests (that) he stole the money.

sentences.cn: 症状显示这是轻微心脏病发作。
sentences.en: The symptoms suggest a minor heart attack.

sentences.cn: 照你看，这些结果说明什么呢？
sentences.en: What do these results suggest to you?

sentences.cn: 你言下之意是说我懒？
sentences.en: Are you suggesting (that) I'm lazy?

sentences.cn: 我根本不会有这样的意思。
sentences.en: I would never suggest such a thing.

sentences.cn: 他认为 7 岁大的学生的测试分数和班级的规模有关系。
sentences.en: He suggested a link between class size and test results of seven-year-olds...
